round1: Code Relay - 3 problem statements will be given to team - Each member will be given 10 mins in different interval. - Time and problem-solving based evaluation 50% to be taken for next round
round2: Scavenger Hunt - Based on code, decode the code and find some object or place and click picture of that - Time based evaluation Winner and runner’s up to be declared
tagLine: Chef is cooking some delicious code
outcome: Your coding knowledge will be tested with some fun activity at last

round1: Code error hunting / Bug fixing championship Again, 50% students to be taken for next round
round2: A pattern / Object will be provided to students and they have code it. - Time-based evaluation. 50% to be taken for next round
round3: To test problem solving, logical thinking and coding skills on platforms like HackerEarth / HackerRank. - Time-based evaluation 3 winners to be selected
outcome: You can gain knowledge of problem solving by some fun activity

round1: Every participant will have to form a group of 4 people and will be given a task to perform a scene while each contestant will be restricted to speak a particular number of words at a time.
round2: Questions Only! Participants will be given a location/situation to perform a scene while they’ll be allowed to only ask questions.

round1: 1 Pen paper quiz based on General Knowledge.
round2: A duo or trio form of delegates will represent their branch/department and tackle with their generalized problem statement from their technical disciplinary approach.
round3: Individual shortlisted delegates will represent a particular Indian state and solve national issues as well as represent their state at Parliament.

round1: Only circuit and components will be shown and then they will have to answer the output. Time Limit:
round2: In second round they will have an input and an output using which they will have to identify the given circuit and describe the uses of the same. At the same time questions will be asked related to the circuit and cumulative marks for both will be given that will lead them to next round. Time Limit:
round3: Here they will have an input and an output using which they will have to design the circuit. Time Limit:
tagLine: Can you reveal the Black Box?
outcome: They will recall circuits and mainly, they will learn about various circuit.

round1: Quiz with the concept of Snakes and Ladders will be there and various concepts of micro-controller will be covered. Time Limit:
round2: The participants will be provided with errors in circuits based on Arduino and they have to solve it in given time period without any additional components. Time Limit:
round3: Here they will have to write a basic code for a given problem statement for controllers like Node MCU. Time Limit
outcome: Concepts of micro-controllers and coding will be developed

round1: Presentation on general electrical devices or systems based on level of study and topics will be given by us. Selection will be based on presentation skills, clear idea of the topic an d clothing style.
round2: Technical Interview will be conducted in which the professionalism of the students will be tested. We will test the intellectual skills, technical skills, presentation skills, willingness to learn the subject, interests of the participants. The person who convinces our jury will win the roun

round1: Create a mini vlog reel of footage covered inside the college on the 1st and 2nd day of Udaan
round2: Live photography where participants will have to capture pictures on the provided theme within 3-4 hours

round1: In this round, all the participants would be divided into teams of two / three. These teams would have to overcome certain hurdles as a group. On the basis of their performance, the top 15-20 teams would be selected for the next round
round2: In this, the participants’ mental ability and judgments of the situations will be tested via a form with certain questions. Time Limit:
round3: This would be a jury-based round. Every challenger now will have to face a panel of three to four judges. Here we would be looking forward to a person who gives the wittiest, humorous yet the most sensible answers.

round1: Logo Identification from the given logos
round2: Manipulation of the Poster/ Flyer provided

round1: Participants will get virtual money and will have to make a maximum profit by trading.

round3: Story Creation / Standup using memes (Surpsrize Round)

round1: On Spot Debate on the theme
